## Description {#details}

An <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">SCC</a> of the call graph.

This represents a Strongly Connected Component of the direct call graph â€“ ignoring indirect calls and function references. It stores this as a collection of call graph nodes. While the order of nodes in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">SCC</a> is stable, it is not any particular order.

The SCCs are nested within a <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/refscc">RefSCC</a></code>, see below for details about that outer structure. SCCs do not support mutation of the call graph, that must be done through the containing <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/refscc">RefSCC</a></code> in order to fully reason about the ordering and connections of the graph.

Definition at line 416 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/lazycallgraph-h">LazyCallGraph.h</a>.

<MemberDefinition

Print a short description useful for debugging or logging.

We print the function names in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">SCC</a> wrapped in &#39;()&#39;s and skipping the middle functions if there are a large number.

### getName() {#abac122ed462169c3afbf43309644b415}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="std::string llvm::LazyCallGraph::SCC::getName () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Provide a short name by printing this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">SCC</a> to a std::string.

This copes with the fact that we don&#39;t have a name per se for an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">SCC</a> while still making the use of this in debugging and logging useful.

### isAncestorOf() {#a024bad6935b15f7080b08b5dfec4eade}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool LazyCallGraph::SCC::isAncestorOf (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">SCC</a> &amp; C) const</>}>
Test if this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">SCC</a> is an ancestor of <em>C</em>.

Note that in the worst case this is linear in the number of edges departing the current <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">SCC</a> and every <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">SCC</a> in the entire graph reachable from this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">SCC</a>. Thus this very well may walk every edge in the entire call graph! Do not call this in a tight loop!

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/lazycallgraph-h/#l00493">493</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/lazycallgraph-h">LazyCallGraph.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/lazycallgraph-cpp/#l00299">299</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/lazycallgraph-cpp">LazyCallGraph.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### verify() {#a06a877510671d08945cc742ac3719559}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void LazyCallGraph::SCC::verify ()">
Verify invariants about the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">SCC</a>.

This will attempt to validate all of the basic invariants within an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">SCC</a>, but not that it is a strongly connected component per se. Primarily useful while building and updating the graph to check that basic properties are in place rather than having inexplicable crashes later.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/lazycallgraph-h/#l00468">468</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/lazycallgraph-h">LazyCallGraph.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/lazycallgraph-cpp/#l00250">250</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/lazycallgraph-cpp">LazyCallGraph.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
